decks.notes: This control deck revolves around using Breya, Etherium Shaper as the commander to outvalue opponents through a combination of removal, counterspells, card advantage, and efficient threats. The deck aims to control the game by disrupting opponents' game plans with cards like Thoughtseize, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Hullbreacher while protecting its own position with countermagic such as Spell Snare and Mana Leak. Breya's ability to generate Thopter tokens provides a steady source of threats that can close out the game quickly if left unchecked. The deck also includes a versatile removal suite with cards like Swords to Plowshares, Fatal Push, and Prismatic Ending to handle a variety of threats.

The key strategy of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells while maintaining control of the battlefield. Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd serves as the commander, providing a strong presence on the battlefield and enabling aggressive plays. The deck includes a variety of cards that allow for efficient removal of threats, such as Swords to Plowshares and Skyclave Apparition, as well as cards that disrupt the opponent's game plan, like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Drannith Magistrate. By combining aggro creatures with disruptive spells, this deck aims to establish early board presence and maintain control throughout the game, ultimately leading to victory through overwhelming pressure.

This deck relies on the synergy between Rograkh and Ikra Shidiqi to generate early aggression and overwhelm opponents with a combination of fast mana generation and disruptive spells. The key strategy of the deck is to efficiently ramp into powerful spells such as Tainted Pact and Yawgmoth's Will while disrupting opponents with cards like Opposition Agent and Thoughtseize. By combining fast mana acceleration with disruptive elements, the deck seeks to create a proactive game plan that puts pressure on opponents from the early turns, allowing for a strong finish with cards like Tendrils of Agony and Peer into the Abyss to secure the win.

The deck focuses on fast aggressive plays using a combination of cheap mana accelerants, rituals, and tutors to quickly power out threats and disrupt opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Partner commanders Ikra Shidiqi and Rograkh allows for flexibility and synergy in the deck. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's hand with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also ramping up mana with cards like Dark Ritual and Pentad Prism. It looks to close out the game quickly with powerful finishers like Tendrils of Agony or an explosive combo using Yawgmoth's Will. Overall, the deck prioritizes speed and efficiency in order to overwhelm opponents and secure a quick victory.

This deck revolves around a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing Spider-Man 2099 as the commander. The strategy focuses on casting low-cost spells to control the board and deal damage quickly to the opponent. With a variety of instant and sorcery spells at its disposal, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plans while building up its own threats. Cards like Snapcaster Mage and Dreadhorde Arcanist allow for cards to be recast from the graveyard, ensuring a steady stream of spells throughout the game. By combining efficient removal, countermagic, and evasive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and True-Name Nemesis, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.
